page.title: 07Agriculture in Laindon
page.content: The landscape of the area is undulating. On the steepest slopes, south of the village of Little Burstead the land is given over to rough pasture The major part of the flatter land is used for arable farming of cereal crops of wheat and barley. Field size is relatively small due to the A127 to the south and the steeper slopes to the north. A strip of land running from north east to south east is divided up into smallholdings, some specialising in market gardening, some in small scale "orchard" fruit production such as apples. The remainder are given over to family houses with large gardens.
